-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | A framework for code and document generation for scientific software - Utils SubPackage
--   
--   Please see the README on GitHub at
--   <a>https://github.com/JacquesCarette/Drasil#readme</a>
@package drasil-utils
@version 0.1.1.0


-- | Functions for constructing CSV files as a <a>Doc</a>.
module Utils.Drasil.CSV

-- | Creates a CSV file as a <a>Doc</a> from a <a>String</a> matrix.
makeCSV :: [[String]] -> Doc

module Utils.Drasil.Directory

-- | Creates a directory if it does not already exist (optionally with all
--   missing parent directories).
--   
--   Implementation uses doesPathExist to check if the directory exists
--   rather than createDirectoryIfMissing True, which would create the
--   directory regardless of whether it exists or not, potentially leading
--   to an error that appears in `make debug` logs.
createDirIfMissing :: Bool -> FilePath -> IO ()


-- | Common <a>Doc</a>-related functions for writting printers with a
--   little more clarity.
module Utils.Drasil.Document

-- | Creates a blank document with no text.
blank :: Doc

-- | Indents a document (by 4 spaces).
indent :: Doc -> Doc

-- | Indents a list of Docs and combines into one Doc.
indentList :: [Doc] -> Doc
contSep :: Separator

-- | Filter blank <a>Doc</a>s from a list.
filterEmpty :: [Doc] -> [Doc]

-- | Merge a list of <a>String</a>s into a <a>Doc</a> format:
--   
--   e.g., `listToDoc [a,b,c,...] ~= a, b, c, ...`
listToDoc :: [String] -> Doc

-- | Separates document sections.
type Separator = Doc


-- | Useful functions for working with English-related <a>String</a>s.
module Utils.Drasil.English

-- | String capitalization.
capitalize :: String -> String

-- | Comma separated list with "and" before final item.
stringList :: [String] -> String


-- | Functions for working with lists.
module Utils.Drasil.Lists

-- | Check if list has at least 2 elements.
atLeast2 :: [a] -> Bool

-- | Replaces all elements of a target list that belong to a provided "bad"
--   input list.
replaceAll :: Eq a => [a] -> a -> [a] -> [a]

-- | Checks if the first set is a subset of the second.
subsetOf :: Eq a => [a] -> [a] -> Bool

-- | Sort a list, removing all duplicates
nubSort :: Ord a => [a] -> [a]

-- | Interweaves two lists together <tt>[[a,b,c],[d,e,f]] -&gt;
--   [a,d,b,e,c,f]</tt>.
weave :: [[a]] -> [a]

-- | Fold helper function that applies f to all but the last element,
--   applies g to last element and the accumulator.
foldle :: (a -> a -> a) -> (a -> a -> a) -> a -> [a] -> a

-- | Fold helper function that applies f to all but last element, applies g
--   to last element and accumulator without starting value, does not work
--   for empty list.
foldle1 :: (a -> a -> a) -> (a -> a -> a) -> [a] -> a

-- | Convert "row" of elements into "column" of elements.
toColumn :: [a] -> [[a]]

-- | Create a table body (not including header row) by applying the given
--   functions to the column elements of the table rows (in order). The
--   first argument is a list of functions to be applied (one per column).
--   This essentially creates the rows. The second argument is a list of
--   elements apply the functions to.
--   
--   For example, <tt>mkTable [id, *5] [1,2,3]</tt> should produce a table:
--   
--   <pre>
--   | 1 |  5 |
--   | 2 | 10 |
--   | 3 | 15 |
--   </pre>
mkTable :: [a -> b] -> [a] -> [[b]]

module Utils.Drasil.Maps
invert :: Ord v => Map k [v] -> Map v [k]

module Utils.Drasil.Strings

-- | Replace occurences of special characters
--   (<tt>",~`-=!</tt>#$%^&amp;*+[]\;'/|"&lt;&gt;? "<tt>) with underscores
--   (</tt>"_"@).
--   
--   TODO: This can probably become a bit more comprehensive, anything
--   other than a-z, A-Z, or 0-9 could probably be replaced.
toPlainName :: String -> String

-- | Replace underscores in a string with periods (<tt>.</tt>).
repUnd :: String -> String


-- | Gather Drasil's utility functions and re-export for easy use.
module Utils.Drasil

-- | Creates a directory if it does not already exist (optionally with all
--   missing parent directories).
--   
--   Implementation uses doesPathExist to check if the directory exists
--   rather than createDirectoryIfMissing True, which would create the
--   directory regardless of whether it exists or not, potentially leading
--   to an error that appears in `make debug` logs.
createDirIfMissing :: Bool -> FilePath -> IO ()

-- | Creates a blank document with no text.
blank :: Doc

-- | Indents a document (by 4 spaces).
indent :: Doc -> Doc

-- | Indents a list of Docs and combines into one Doc.
indentList :: [Doc] -> Doc

-- | Filter blank <a>Doc</a>s from a list.
filterEmpty :: [Doc] -> [Doc]

-- | Merge a list of <a>String</a>s into a <a>Doc</a> format:
--   
--   e.g., `listToDoc [a,b,c,...] ~= a, b, c, ...`
listToDoc :: [String] -> Doc

-- | Separates document sections.
type Separator = Doc
contSep :: Separator

-- | String capitalization.
capitalize :: String -> String

-- | Comma separated list with "and" before final item.
stringList :: [String] -> String

-- | Check if list has at least 2 elements.
atLeast2 :: [a] -> Bool

-- | Replaces all elements of a target list that belong to a provided "bad"
--   input list.
replaceAll :: Eq a => [a] -> a -> [a] -> [a]

-- | Checks if the first set is a subset of the second.
subsetOf :: Eq a => [a] -> [a] -> Bool

-- | Sort a list, removing all duplicates
nubSort :: Ord a => [a] -> [a]

-- | Interweaves two lists together <tt>[[a,b,c],[d,e,f]] -&gt;
--   [a,d,b,e,c,f]</tt>.
weave :: [[a]] -> [a]

-- | Fold helper function that applies f to all but the last element,
--   applies g to last element and the accumulator.
foldle :: (a -> a -> a) -> (a -> a -> a) -> a -> [a] -> a

-- | Fold helper function that applies f to all but last element, applies g
--   to last element and accumulator without starting value, does not work
--   for empty list.
foldle1 :: (a -> a -> a) -> (a -> a -> a) -> [a] -> a

-- | Convert "row" of elements into "column" of elements.
toColumn :: [a] -> [[a]]

-- | Create a table body (not including header row) by applying the given
--   functions to the column elements of the table rows (in order). The
--   first argument is a list of functions to be applied (one per column).
--   This essentially creates the rows. The second argument is a list of
--   elements apply the functions to.
--   
--   For example, <tt>mkTable [id, *5] [1,2,3]</tt> should produce a table:
--   
--   <pre>
--   | 1 |  5 |
--   | 2 | 10 |
--   | 3 | 15 |
--   </pre>
mkTable :: [a -> b] -> [a] -> [[b]]
invert :: Ord v => Map k [v] -> Map v [k]

-- | Replace occurences of special characters
--   (<tt>",~`-=!</tt>#$%^&amp;*+[]\;'/|"&lt;&gt;? "<tt>) with underscores
--   (</tt>"_"@).
--   
--   TODO: This can probably become a bit more comprehensive, anything
--   other than a-z, A-Z, or 0-9 could probably be replaced.
toPlainName :: String -> String

-- | Replace underscores in a string with periods (<tt>.</tt>).
repUnd :: String -> String

-- | Creates a CSV file as a <a>Doc</a> from a <a>String</a> matrix.
makeCSV :: [[String]] -> Doc
